update.description:
Plugin that dynamically shows the list of Ignition Topics. All topics that are part of Ignition Messages are introspectable and can be expanded and collapsed.

It also has a search widget for filtering topics or fields by name.

Thanks to @iche033 and @chapulina for the suggestions on porting most of the code from Gazebo.

![topic_viewer.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/4211734814-topic_viewer.png)
update.title: Topic viewer

content.raw: Removed in a09257e.
content.html: Removed in a09257e.

update.description:
Plugin that dynamically shows the list of Ignition Topics. All topics that are part of Ignition Messages are introspectable and can be expanded and collapsed.

It also has a search widget for filtering topics or fields by name.

Thanks to @iche033 and @chapulina for the suggestions on porting most of the code from Gazebo.

![topic_viewer.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/4211734814-topic_viewer.png)
update.title: Topic viewer

content.raw:
I have some suggestions on pull request #16.

Another thing I noticed but didn't address there is that this widget is currently really geared towards plotting, and only plottable fields are listed. We should display all fields.

I also think it would be nice to make it possible to drag a topic from this widget to `TopicEcho`.
content.html:
I have some suggestions on pull request #16.

Another thing I noticed but didn't address there is that this widget is currently really geared towards plotting, and only plottable fields are listed. We should display all fields.

I also think it would be nice to make it possible to drag a topic from this widget to TopicEcho.

content.raw: When running standalone, the plugin is loaded inside a `QDialog`, while if it comes from a configuration or from the top menu, it is loaded inside a `QDockWidget`. Pull request #16 has fixes to the style on both cases.
content.html: When running standalone, the plugin is loaded inside a QDialog, while if it comes from a configuration or from the top menu, it is loaded inside a QDockWidget. Pull request #16 has fixes to the style on both cases.

content.raw:
I think I'm not getting style information.

![topic_view.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/598517526-topic_view.png)

I compiled, installed, and ran:

```
ign gui -s libTopicViewer.so
```

Is there another step required?
content.html:
I think I'm not getting style information.

I compiled, installed, and ran:

ign gui -s libTopicViewer.so

Is there another step required?

content.raw: Good to know, thanks!
content.html: Good to know, thanks!

content.raw: The same for up
content.html: The same for up

content.raw: `mainwindow_bg` is not used
content.html: mainwindow_bg is not used

content.raw: The `down_spin_arrow`s are not used
content.html: The down_spin_arrows are not used

content.raw: Just a note in case you weren't aware of it: since this is only one plugin and we're not passing any special configurations to it, it could also be loaded like this from any directory: `ign gui -s libTopicViewer.so` :wink:
content.html: Just a note in case you weren't aware of it: since this is only one plugin and we're not passing any special configurations to it, it could also be loaded like this from any directory: ign gui -s libTopicViewer.so

update.description:
Plugin that dynamically shows the list of Ignition Topics. All topics that are part of Ignition Messages are introspectable and can be expanded and collapsed.

It also has a search widget for filtering topics or fields by name.

Thanks to @iche033 and @chapulina for the suggestions on porting most of the code from Gazebo.

![topic_viewer.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/4211734814-topic_viewer.png)
update.title: Topic viewer

content.raw: I think it's fine to leave this here, but just double-checking, it is not being used, right?
content.html: I think it's fine to leave this here, but just double-checking, it is not being used, right?

content.raw:
Thanks for porting all these styles from Gazebo! We will need to tweak them a bit because some of the other widgets are looking weird. I've been trying to follow @spaepcke's [style guide](https://drive.google.com/a/osrfoundation.org/uc?id=0B_0d9M9XDFBVa2RiMnJFYnRVWUk&export=download).

![pubsubstyle.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/2543278736-pubsubstyle.png)

Note that in the short term, we will have a documented way for downstream projects to override the style with their own custom styles. It is possible that then, we move all the styles currently here to `gazebo_experimental` and either leave ign-gui with the native Qt style, or a more neutral material design style.
content.html:
Thanks for porting all these styles from Gazebo! We will need to tweak them a bit because some of the other widgets are looking weird. I've been trying to follow @spaepcke's style guide.

Note that in the short term, we will have a documented way for downstream projects to override the style with their own custom styles. It is possible that then, we move all the styles currently here to gazebo_experimental and either leave ign-gui with the native Qt style, or a more neutral material design style.

content.raw: Since this widget can be used for other things besides plotting, we could rename this to be more general.
content.html: Since this widget can be used for other things besides plotting, we could rename this to be more general.

content.raw: `#include <ignition/msgs.hh>` ?
content.html: #include <ignition/msgs.hh> ?
